Audi R8 0-60 times

Autotk.com offers accurate information on Audi R8 0-60 times and quarter mile from trusted sources. You may also keep track of how 0-60 times of Audi R8 changed across years and check out the model’s competitors with the same acceleration performance.

Our mission is to present an easy-to-read and comprehensive information on Audi R8 0-60 mph and quarter mile for the devoted geeks, as it is an essential indicator of the vehicle power.

Having an elegant and classy sedan with top-class performance and best pickup is always a dream for everyone. Well, now your dreams can be fulfilled with the new and revolutionary Audi R8. The R8 is a beautiful and very attractive convertible which is definitely a treat to everyone’s eyes. Besides that, it is a simply marvelous and amazing to drive and great to live with. Basically, it has everything that you will love to have in a sports car. If you are looking for a sports car with mid-engine European vehicle, then this can be the perfect one.

 

Overview

With all-wheel-drive and mid-engine, this two-seater coupe is a supercar. You will find the chassis and drivetrain quite similar to the more durable and expensive Lamborghini Huracan. But you will get the Audi R8 at much lower cost than that. Though this 2017 Audi R8 ranked 7th out of 12 cars in the Best Driver’s Car Competition, it stood first in the Great Drag Race 6 of World. Audi R8 passed its 0-60 times test with a spectacular result of 2.6 seconds; it finished the quarter mile in just 10.6 seconds at the speed of 130.3 mph.

 

Engine

You will be amazed to see the engine specifications of this car. The second generation Audi R8, which was first revealed at the Geneva Car Show in 2015, arrived for 2017 model year in coupe variants. The new car has a lot of similarities when it comes to the chassis of the first generation model. It resembles a lot like the new Lamborghini Huracan. At first, this new car is equipped with the powerful and amazing 5.2-liter V-10 engine that offers a power of 532 HP and a torque of 398 lb-ft. It will also come with the second option of 601 HP and 413 lb-ft torque in the V10 Plus model. The automatic transmission will offer a seven-speed transmission with dual-clutch.

 

Exterior & Interior

Both the interior and exterior look of this coupe has a high standard. With leather seats and navigation facility it looks very classy and elegant. If you choose for the premium package, then you will get leather in all other parts of the center console, dash, etc. This coupe also comes with Bang and Olufsen system for the excellent audio experience. The seats are also powered with 18 ways of adjustments. So, you can adjust it according to your comfort. You can get the Carbon package with the premium package that will add carbon fiber inlay on the center console and also in the instrument panel and vents.

 

Verdict

Audi is planning to build 999 of this model. 320 out of those will come to the US (United States). The long black striped numbered dash plate will add it its elegance and significance. A major renovation and redesign are likely to be expected every five years. So, you will not get that much changes in the design or look. But you can expect a significant upgrade in the engines and performances. So, if you are looking forward to buying a sports coupe, then this is the perfect one for you.

 

CarAndDriver Test Results

Zero to 60 mph: 2.9 sec
Zero to 100 mph: 6.5 sec
Zero to 130 mph: 11.0 sec
Zero to 150 mph: 15.6 sec
Rolling start, 5-60 mph: 3.5 sec
Top gear, 30-50 mph: 2.2 sec
Top gear, 50-70 mph: 2.3 sec
Standing ¼-mile: 10.9 sec @ 129 mph
Top speed (mfr's claim): 205 mph
Braking, 70-0 mph: 153 ft
Roadholding, 300-ft-dia skidpad: 1.00 g
